langReco.eval

Class Performance

  • java.lang.Object
    • langReco.eval.Performance

  • public class Performance
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Performance: class to compute the performance of a recognition system.
    Author:
    N. Hernandez and S. Quiniou (2015)

      Method using the sentences given in two lists to compute the accuracy of a recognition system, i.e. the number of sentences whose language is correctly recognized by the system.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public static double evaluate(java.lang.String goldLangPath,
              java.lang.String hypLangPath)
        Method using the sentences given in two files to compute the accuracy of a recognition system, i.e. the number of sentences whose language is correctly recognized by the system. The first file contains the language annotation of each sentence of a reference file and the second file contains the hypothesis language of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        goldLangPath - the path of the file containing the gold annotation of a sentences of the reference file.
        hypLangPath - the path of the file containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the recognition system.

      • evaluate

        public static double evaluate(java.util.List<java.lang.String> goldLang,
              java.util.List<java.lang.String> hypLang)
        Method using the sentences given in two lists to compute the accuracy of a recognition system, i.e. the number of sentences whose language is correctly recognized by the system. The first list contains the language annotation of each sentence of a reference list and the second listr contains the hypothesis language of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        goldLang - the list containing the gold annotation of the sentences of a reference list.
        hypLang - the list containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the recognition system.

      • evaluateLanguages

        public static java.lang.String evaluateLanguages(java.lang.String goldLangPath,
                                 java.lang.String hypLangPath)
        Method using the sentences given in two files to compute the accuracy of a recognition system for each language, i.e. the number of sentences whose language is correctly recognized by the system. The first file contains the language annotation of each sentence of a reference file and the second file contains the hypothesis language of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        goldLangPath - the path of the file containing the gold annotation of a sentences of the reference file.
        hypLangPath - the path of the file containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        a String containing the accuracy of the recognition system for each language.

      • evaluateLanguages

        public static java.lang.String evaluateLanguages(java.util.List<java.lang.String> goldLang,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> hypLang)
        Method using the sentences given in two lists to compute the accuracy of a recognition system for each language, i.e. the number of sentences whose language is correctly recognized by the system. The first list contains the language annotation of each sentence of a reference list and the second listr contains the hypothesis language of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        goldLang - the list containing the gold annotation of the sentences of a reference list.
        hypLang - the list containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        a String containing the accuracy of the recognition system for each language.
